context: This evaluation assesses how well the engineer uses the jquery.payment library to implement a payment form validation system with custom card type support. The focus is entirely on correct usage of jquery.payment API methods, proper card type extension, and integration of validation functions.

checklist.name: Custom Card Registration
checklist.description: Correctly defines and registers the RegionCard type by creating a card object with all required properties (type, patterns, format, length, cvcLength, luhn) and adds it to the $.payment.cards array using unshift() or appropriate method to ensure pattern priority.

checklist.name: Card Type Detection
checklist.description: Uses $.payment.cardType() method to detect the card type from the card number string in the getCardInfo function.

checklist.name: Card Number Validation
checklist.description: Uses $.payment.validateCardNumber() method to validate card numbers including Luhn algorithm checking in the getCardInfo function.

checklist.name: Card Number Formatting
checklist.description: Uses $.payment.formatCardNumber() method to format the card number with appropriate spacing in the getCardInfo function.

checklist.name: Expiry Parsing
checklist.description: Uses $.payment.cardExpiryVal() method to parse the expiry string into month and year components in the validateExpiry function.

checklist.name: Expiry Validation
checklist.description: Uses $.payment.validateCardExpiry() method with either separate month/year parameters or the parsed object from cardExpiryVal to validate that the expiry date is in the future.

checklist.name: CVC Validation
checklist.description: Uses $.payment.validateCardCVC() method with both the CVC value and optional card type parameter to perform type-aware security code validation in the validateSecurityCode function.
